title: The Extraordinary Week of Oscar Murphy: Everyday Hero
summary: Oscar Murphy discovers his ability to manipulate art and sport into superheroic feats to thwart a mysterious villain in his city, all within an action-packed week.
summaryGerman: Oscar Murphy entdeckt seine Fähigkeit, Kunst und Sport in heldenhafte Taten umzuwandeln, um innerhalb einer aktionsreichen Woche einen geheimnisvollen Bösewicht in seiner Stadt zu vereiteln.
summaryDutch: Oscar Murphy ontdekt zijn vermogen om kunst en sport te manipuleren in heldhaftige daden om een mysterieuze schurk in zijn stad te dwarsbomen, allemaal binnen een actievolle week.
summaryFrench: Oscar Murphy découvre sa capacité à manipuler l'art et le sport en exploits de super-héros pour contrer un méchant mystérieux dans sa ville, le tout en une semaine pleine d'action.

story.text: Oscar Murphy starts his week sketching at the park, when he suddenly sketches a scene that becomes real — a child stops chasing a runaway kite as the wind settles down.

Excited about his newfound powers, Oscar experiments by drawing a scene where he's winning a tennis match against an ex-champion. To his astonishment, it turns into reality the next day at a local tournament.
Inspired by his successes, Oscar draws a detailed map of the city, marking suspicious activities he's noticed. As he does, clues begin to glow on the paper, leading him to a hidden crime scene.
Following the glowing clues, Oscar uncovers a plot to rob the city’s museum. He sketches a trap that safely ensnares the thieves as they enter the museum.
Media hail Oscar as a mysterious hero. While he enjoys the attention, he sketches a rainy scene to ensure a peaceful night without crimes, wishing for a break.
A mysterious figure challenges Oscar, having discovered his secret. They engage in a 'draw-off' at the city square, where reality bends with each sketch.
In a final showdown, Oscar sketches an overwhelming sports festival that traps the villain with relentless, playful competition. The city celebrates as the villain tires and gives up.

ending: And so, Oscar Murphy not only saved his city but also learned that the true power lies within one’s creativity and the courage to use it.
moral: Creativity is not just an art but a powerful tool when wielded with courage and good intentions.
